intro: Amanoa patula, commonly known as the Hawaiian violet, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of violet or purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Amanoa patula is considered an endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species. Conservation efforts are underway to protect and propagate this unique Hawaiian endemic plant.
